intro.speaker: Zaom
intro.line: Hmm... The fort is in terrible danger, and it only seems to be getting worse...

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: ...We have word that the rebels have already gained control of the gates, sir.

intro.speaker: Zaom
intro.line: Hmph! I suppose it was only a matter of time until the rebels came to free the prisoners. Well, we're ready for it. If worse comes to worst, go ahead with our... last resort. Do I make myself clear?

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Clear as a vial of Pure Water, sir.

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: So this is the Imperial prison camp...

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: As I understand it, most of the soldiers captured throughout Thracia are sent here. It's extremely likely that troops captured from our army are in this very camp—yet this chance will be squandered if you don't hurry.

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: Have you already forgotten? We've a report that clearly states a battalion of Loptian mages are en route.

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: Could it be the Schwarze Rosen...? Well, let's not stay and find out! We must make haste to rescue the prisoners!

battle.speaker: Schwarze Rosen Soldier
battle.line: Soldiers of Leonster yet remain here...? Hah! Now they'll witness the sublime power of Loptous!

boss.speaker: Zaom
boss.line: You can still walk away! Just go home!

end.speaker: Julius
end.line: Hmm... It's not enough that Bloom is struggling to hold Conote against the Isaachian rebels—now the Friege army has lost this fort as well. What a spectacular family of failures... House Friege is a joke.

end.speaker: Ishtar
end.line: I... I apologize on behalf of my kin...

end.speaker: Julius
end.line: Heh, heh... You're hardly at fault, Ishtar. There's no need for you to apologize. Yet having said that, I can't allow you to join the battle in Conote yourself. I... need you with me.

end.speaker: Ishtar
end.line: As you wish... But where are we to go instead?

end.speaker: Julius
end.line: Miletos. Hilda has been pestering me to come.

end.speaker: Julius
end.line: To see the results of her harvest, of course. I must say, she's been quite delighted with governing the city since I gave her the throne.

end.speaker: Ishtar
end.line: Mother... has... Do you mean to say... she's been conducting child hunts?

end.speaker: Julius
end.line: You know, Miletos' climate is quite pleasant this time of year. I think it would be an ideal place for two people to spend time together. Yes, that sounds perfect... I'll buy you a dress of fine silk, Ishtar. And what else would go nicely with it...? Ah, I know just the thing! A ruby tiara! Hilda is already arranging a most splendid banquet for us, I'm sure. Ishtar, you can dress up and take everyone by surprise with your captivating beauty. I'm dearly looking forward to it... Oh, Ishtar, I'm so glad to have you by my side...

end.speaker: Julius
end.line: Ishtar... That man, Reinhardt... I don't want him near us anymore.

end.speaker: Ishtar
end.line: Reinhardt?! He's watched over me since I was a child! I rely on him every day!

end.speaker: Julius
end.line: I don't care! I hate the way he looks at you! If I see him, I'll pluck out his eyes myself!

end.speaker: Ishtar
end.line: Ah...! I... I understand... Forgive me, but I must ask this of you: let Reinhardt go home. Please.

end.speaker: Julius
end.line: Heh, heh... Very well, we'll leave him be. Let's be off! Oh, Ishtar... how I love you!
